result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 16CM57 and 16CM557 but Consecutive to 14CF1505 and any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges; the State shall have 60 days to determine restitution.
May not have contact with Jamie C or Charles S, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 3 years with conditions Concurrent with 16CM57 & 16CM557, but Consecutive to 14CF1505 and any other sentence.   Restitution is ordered and the State shall have 60 days to determine any amount of restitution.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision. Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Jamie C. or Charles S. unless permitted by the court.  Appeal Rights given.

Scheduling Order

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. Mueller, appeared with Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Case is not resolved at this time and scheduling order is given to parties.  16CM57 will trail this case.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Joshua J. Mueller, appeared with Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder especially for Attorney Andrea K Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo is ill and unable to appear.  Bench Warrant is vacated (not yet issued) and prior bond will not be forfeited.  Atty Breckenfelder states DE had some confusion with court date due to vehicle problems.  Court increases DE's bond in 16CM57. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Voluntary appearance requested by Atty Rufo for DE but neither party is available to appear this week.  Voluntary Appearance scheduled 4/5/16 at 10:00 AM with DE's new file.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Andrea K Rufo appeared on behalf of Defendant Joshua J. Mueller who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Rufo has no explanation for DE's non appearance but requests any warrant be stayed.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $4000 Cash Bond; however, warrant will be stayed until Tuesday at which time bond will be forfeited if no voluntary appearance is requested.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
Argument heard on DE's bond motion in 16CM57 and motion is granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.
